item.title: Glennis add a quote by John Scalzi
item.description: "Here's a quick rule of thumb: Don't annoy science fiction writers. These are people who destroy entire planets before lunch. Think of what they'll do to you." -- John Scalzi

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Glennis add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "[D]on't ever apologize to an author for buying something in paperback, or taking it out from a library (that's what they're there for. Use your library). Don't apologize to this author for buying books second hand, or getting them from bookcrossing or borrowing a friend's copy. What's important to me is that people read the books and enjoy them, and that, at some point in there, the book was bought by someone. And that people who like things, tell other people. The most important thing is that people read... " -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "By now, it is probably very late at night, and you have stayed up to read this book when you should have gone to sleep. If this is the case, then I commend you for falling into my trap. It is a writer's greatest pleasure to hear that someone was kept up until the unholy hours of the morning reading one of his books. It goes back to authors being terrible people who delight in the suffering of others. Plus, we get a kickback from the caffeine industry..." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "The only way of discovering the limits of the possible is to venture a little way past them into the impossible." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Hope Smiles from the threshold of the year to come, Whispering 'it will be happier'..." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Glennis add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Life is pain, highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something." -- William Goldman

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means..." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Glennis add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "We need to make books cool again. If you go home with somebody and they don't have books, don't fuck them." -- John Waters

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Quotation, n: The act of repeating erroneously the words of another." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "I was 32 when I started cooking; up until then, I just ate." -- Julia Child

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "I shouldn't think even millionaires could eat anything nicer than new bread and real butter and honey for tea." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "Never say 'no' to adventures. Always say 'yes,' otherwise you'll lead a very dull life." -- Ian Fleming

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Marion Zimmer Bradley
item.description: "Remain true to yourself, child. If you know your own heart, you will always have one friend who does not lie." -- Marion Zimmer Bradley

item.title: Glennis add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "You know, Hobbes, some days even my lucky rocket ship underpants don't help." -- Bill Watterson
